briefdescription.para: Sections for namespaced settings.
Construct a QgsSettings object for accessing settings of the application called application from the organization called organization, and with parent parent.

memberdef.argsstring: (QSettings::Scope scope, const QString &organization, const QString &application=QString(), QObject *parent=nullptr)
memberdef.name: QgsSettings

briefdescription.para: Construct a QgsSettings object for accessing settings of the application called application from the organization called organization, and with parent parent.

detaileddescription.para: If scope is QSettings::UserScope, the QSettings object searches user-specific settings first, before it searches system-wide settings as a fallback. If scope is QSettings::SystemScope, the QSettings object ignores user-specific settings and provides access to system-wide settings.
The storage format is set to QSettings::NativeFormat (i.e. calling setDefaultFormat() before calling this constructor has no effect).
If no application name is given, the QSettings object will only access the organization-wide locations.

memberdef.argsstring: (QSettings::Format format, QSettings::Scope scope, const QString &organization, const QString &application=QString(), QObject *parent=nullptr)
memberdef.name: QgsSettings

briefdescription.para: Construct a QgsSettings object for accessing settings of the application called application from the organization called organization, and with parent parent.

detaileddescription.para: If scope is QSettings::UserScope, the QSettings object searches user-specific settings first, before it searches system-wide settings as a fallback. If scope is QSettings::SystemScope, the QSettings object ignores user-specific settings and provides access to system-wide settings. If format is QSettings::NativeFormat, the native API is used for storing settings. If format is QSettings::IniFormat, the INI format is used.
If no application name is given, the QSettings object will only access the organization-wide locations.

briefdescription.para: Construct a QgsSettings object for accessing the settings stored in the file called fileName, with parent parent.

detaileddescription.para: If the file doesn't already exist, it is created.

If format is QSettings::NativeFormat, the meaning of fileName depends on the platform. On Unix, fileName is the name of an INI file. On macOS and iOS, fileName is the name of a .plist file. On Windows, fileName is a path in the system registry.
If format is QSettings::IniFormat, fileName is the name of an INI file.

Warning: This function is provided for convenience. It works well for accessing INI or .plist files generated by Qt, but might fail on some syntaxes found in such files originated by other programs. In particular, be aware of the following limitations:
QgsSettings provides no way of reading INI "path" entries, i.e., entries with unescaped slash characters. (This is because these entries are ambiguous and cannot be resolved automatically.)
In INI files, QSettings uses the @ character as a metacharacter in some contexts, to encode Qt-specific data types (e.g., @Rect), and might therefore misinterpret it when it occurs in pure INI files.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a QgsSettings object for accessing settings of the application and organization set previously with a call to QCoreApplication::setOrganizationName(), QCoreApplication::setOrganizationDomain(), and QCoreApplication::setApplicationName().

detaileddescription.para: The scope is QSettings::UserScope and the format is defaultFormat() (QSettings::NativeFormat by default). Use setDefaultFormat() before calling this constructor to change the default format used by this constructor.

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of all keys, including subkeys, that can be read using the QSettings object.
Appends prefix to the current group.

detaileddescription.para: The current group is automatically prepended to all keys specified to QSettings. In addition, query functions such as childGroups(), childKeys(), and allKeys() are based on the group. By default, no group is set.

briefdescription.para: Adds prefix to the current group and starts reading from an array. Returns the size of the array.
Adds prefix to the current group and starts writing an array of size size.

detaileddescription.para:
If size is -1 (the default), it is automatically determined based on the indexes of the entries written.
This will completely shadow any existing array with the same name in the global settings

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of all key top-level groups that contain keys that can be read using the QSettings object.
Returns a list of all top-level keys that can be read using the QSettings object.
Removes all entries in the user settings.
Returns true if there exists a setting called key; returns false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: If a group is set using beginGroup(), key is taken to be relative to that group.

briefdescription.para: Closes the array that was started using beginReadArray() or beginWriteArray().
Resets the group to what it was before the corresponding beginGroup() call.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &key, const T &defaultValue, const Section section=NoSection)
memberdef.name: enumValue

briefdescription.para: Returns the setting value for a setting based on an enum.

detaileddescription.para:
This forces the output to be a valid and existing entry of the enum. Hence if the setting value is incorrect, the given default value is returned. This tries first with setting as a string (as the enum) and then as an integer value.
The enum needs to be declared with Q_ENUM, and flags with Q_FLAG (not Q_FLAGS).
for Python bindings, a custom implementation is achieved in Python directly
setEnumValue
flagValue

briefdescription.para: Returns the path where settings written using this QSettings object are stored.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &key, const T &defaultValue, const Section section=NoSection)
memberdef.name: flagValue

briefdescription.para: Returns the setting value for a setting based on a flag.

detaileddescription.para:
This forces the output to be a valid and existing entry of the flag. Hence if the setting value is incorrect, the given default value is returned. This tries first with setting as a string (using a byte array) and then as an integer value.
The flag needs to be declared with Q_FLAG (not Q_FLAGS).
for Python bindings, a custom implementation is achieved in Python directly.
setFlagValue
enumValue

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of all key top-level groups (same as childGroups) but only for groups defined in global settings.
Returns the current group.
Returns the sanitized and prefixed key.
Removes the setting key and any sub-settings of key in a section.
Sets the current array index to i.

detaileddescription.para: Calls to functions such as setValue(), value(), remove(), and contains() will operate on the array entry at that index.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &key, const T &value, const Section section=NoSection)
memberdef.name: setEnumValue

briefdescription.para: Set the value of a setting based on an enum.

detaileddescription.para:
The setting will be saved as string.
The enum needs to be declared with Q_ENUM, and flags with Q_FLAG (not Q_FLAGS).
enumValue
setFlagValue

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &key, const T &value, const Section section=NoSection)
memberdef.name: setFlagValue

briefdescription.para: Set the value of a setting based on a flaf.

detaileddescription.para:
The setting will be saved as string.
The flag needs to be declared with Q_FLAG (not Q_FLAGS).
flagValue
setEnumValue

briefdescription.para: Sets the value of setting key to value.

detaileddescription.para: If the key already exists, the previous value is overwritten. An optional Section argument can be used to set a value to a specific Section.

briefdescription.para: Writes any unsaved changes to permanent storage, and reloads any settings that have been changed in the meantime by another application.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called automatically from QSettings's destructor and by the event loop at regular intervals, so you normally don't need to call it yourself.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &key, const QVariant &defaultValue=QVariant(), Section section=NoSection) const
memberdef.name: value

briefdescription.para: Returns the value for setting key.

detaileddescription.para: If the setting doesn't exist, it will be searched in the Global Settings and if not found, returns defaultValue. If no default value is specified, a default QVariant is returned. An optional Section argument can be used to get a value from a specific Section.

briefdescription.para: Returns the path to the Global Settings QSettings storage file.
Sets the Global Settings QSettings storage file.
This class is a composition of two QSettings instances:

listitem.para: the main QSettings instance is the standard User Settings and
the second one (Global Settings) is meant to provide read-only pre-configuration and defaults to the first one.

detaileddescription.para:
For a given settings key, the function call to value(key, default) will return the first existing setting in the order specified below:
User Settings
Global Settings
Default Value
The path to the Global Settings storage can be set before constructing the QgsSettings objects, with a static call to: static bool setGlobalSettingsPath( QString path );

QgsSettings provides some shortcuts to get/set namespaced settings from/to a specific section:
Core
Gui
Server
Plugins
Auth
App
Providers
Misc
